Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed (fired red), with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of animal, possibly a feline (perhaps part of left front leg, part of body with two added red blobs on side, dots on underbelly and hind leg on right), to left; large rosette below belly as filling ornament; two dilute lines below.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 251, no. 373, pl. 54)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0165) (phase 2)
